title: UK Citizen (Divorcee) marrying Indian Citizen
selftext:
Hello everyone,

I was wondering if anyone knew about how to getting a marriage officially recognised by the Government of India. I have read all I can online and I believe we are eligible to marry under the Special Marriage Act in India.

Brief background - I ( a UK Citizen) have been speaking to a girl for several months. I am now in India for the next 2 months and would like to get married and have this marriage officially recognised by the Indian courts. My Visa is valid for one year and I have all the documentary evidence required including my Divorce certificate. My partner also has all the evidence required.

The one issue I cannot work out is the requirement of a NOC (No Objection Certificate). When I go to the UK website for information on a NOC as it relates to marriage in India, it states a NOC is not required:

https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/marriage-information-note-on-noc

The website states to print off the declaration in the link above and hand it to the registrar in India.

I also found this link which poses a similar situation that may be helpful - https://www.google.com/amp/s/www.scconline.com/blog/post/2022/02/11/registration-of-marriage/amp/

Can someone definitively explain if I need a NOC or not as a UK Citizen? If yes, please can advise how?
